comments.body: Should this be done at construction time rather than when called (since it's supposed to be an immutable snapshot?). Or maybe checking _exampleManifest?
I agree, `hasExampleApp` should not check `example/pubspec.yaml` on-the-fly as it muddles the snapshot semantics. I'll find a better way.
Leaving it to another PR, as "a better way" entails more changes.

What will happen after running `flutter materialize`? I thought that was the whole reason to have two types from the beginning.
I guess the different subdirectories can be made to point into `android/blah/` and `.android/foo` respectively, but `AndroidProject.directory` becomes ambiguous.
But then again, perhaps we never use it on the outside (in that case it should be made private).

Yes, I'll work towards encapsulating it as I implement `materialize`. The idea is that any external code in need of the `directory` getter on `AndroidProject` or `IosProject` should ask for help instead of information, countering "feature envy".
Move return to previous line?
I believe I'm following the style guide here: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Style-guide-for-Flutter-repo#separate-the-if-expression-from-its-statement
FWIW internally we already switched to hand-written `index.html`. We consider it equivalent of Java/ObjC code generated by `flutter create` then edited by hand.
Makes sense, we can generate the index.html only as a part of flutter create and then separate out the generatedPluginRegistry files.
It is worth documenting these to explain that this is a temporary shim?
nit: give this a `const` constructor and make the getter above use that instead
Done.
nit: indentation
thanks
what about a project that was created with v1 and ran make-host-app-editable?

Discussed on chat. If users generally consumed v1 in add-to-app, it would break in the next stable. Those plugins will need to be registered manually since our tools can't predict whether a v1 or v2 style consumption will be made in the host Android project. 

Document in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/36491
Please add a doc comment to this class
Thanks a lot! Totally agree that tests for containsWatchCompanion should be included (... and that writing tests for the plist file is not exactly fun ;-) )

> (... and that writing tests for the plist file is not exactly fun ;-) )

Ugh I know, tell me about it. üòù 
We're working on making tool tests easier to write, though mocking out a plist parser may never be anyone's favorite pastime.
This wasted time shelling out to tooling in nonexistent directories when creating a new project.
what is this change fixing?
It doesn't fix anything, but I thought that it was a little clearer to me to just be explicit since `fromDirectory()` is simply the same thing as `globals.projectFactory.fromDirectory()`.
ahh, right
@stuartmorgan I moved the TODOs scattered around to reexamine the logic to this spot.  Let me know if you want it somewhere else, or need it reworded.

The TODO was really about figuring out what `checkProjects` was for and why we would ever want the `checkProjects = false` behavior since it seemed really bizarre, so it looks like this PR obsoletes it. But I can clean it up later.
Open to naming suggestions here.
Seems reasonable to me. Might want to TODO removal after a stable release cycle or so
Oh, I guess you have to do it this way rather than have a default for the optional argument because `BufferLogger.test()` is non-const?

This method is mostly used to generate dep files.
Could also be convinced to set `version`/`build_number` value to an empty string instead.
Avoid setting a _buildSettingsByBuildContext value to `null`.

This seems like a good fallback, already used in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/e7b7ebc066c1b2a5aa5c19f8961307427e0142a6/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/android/deferred_components_prebuild_validator.dart#L271
See `androidIdentifier` comment, `parent.manifest.appName` seems like a fine fallback value.
Also happy to instead not export these and instead update all imports, including in g3.
